steps: Place the sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass.
Add the bitters and a splash of water to the sugar cube.
Muddle the sugar cube until it is dissolved.
Fill the glass with a large ice cube.
Pour the bourbon or rye whiskey over the ice.
Stir gently to combine and chill the drink.
Express the orange peel over the glass to release the oils, then rub the rim with the peel and drop it into the glass.
drink_image_description: A classic Old Fashioned cocktail in an Old Fashioned glass, featuring a large clear ice cube. The drink is amber in color with a slight sheen from the oils of the orange peel garnish resting on the rim. A maraschino cherry sits at the bottom of the glass. The scene is shot from a close-up angle with warm, soft lighting highlighting the rich amber hues, and a bright background emphasizing the clarity of the ice and the vibrant colors of the garnish.
drink_history: The Old Fashioned is one of the oldest known cocktails, dating back to the early 19th century. It originated in Louisville, Kentucky, and was popularized as a way to enjoy whiskey with a touch of sweetness and bitters. The drink has remained a staple in cocktail culture, revered for its simplicity and balance.

flavor_profile.finish: Warm and lingering with a hint of spice
flavor_profile.balance: Well-balanced between sweetness, bitterness, and the bold flavor of whiskey

serving_size_base.batch_preparation_notes: When making a batch, multiply ingredients accordingly and stir gently to combine.

enhanced_steps.action: Place the sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use a large sugar cube for proper dissolution.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Sugar cube sits at the bottom of the glass.
enhanced_steps.timing_guidance: Muddle until the sugar is fully dissolved.

enhanced_steps.action: Add the bitters and a splash of water to the sugar cube.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Bitters help to balance the sweetness and add complexity.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Bitters evenly coat the sugar cube.

enhanced_steps.action: Muddle the sugar cube until it is dissolved.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Muddling releases the sugar and bitters into the water to create a syrup base.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: The sugar cube is no longer visible, and the mixture looks syrupy.

enhanced_steps.action: Fill the glass with a large ice cube.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: A single large ice cube melts slower, preventing dilution.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Large clear ice cube fills the glass.

enhanced_steps.action: Pour the bourbon or rye whiskey over the ice.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Pour slowly to chill the whiskey evenly.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Whiskey coats the ice cube and fills the glass.

enhanced_steps.action: Stir gently to combine and chill the drink.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use a bar spoon to stir gently for about 20 seconds.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: The liquid becomes well mixed and slightly frosted on the glass.

enhanced_steps.action: Express the orange peel over the glass to release the oils, then rub the rim with the peel and drop it into the glass.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Expressing the peel releases essential oils that add aroma and flavor.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Orange peel twists and oils spray over the glass rim.

enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Adds a touch of sweetness and color contrast.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Cherry rests at the bottom of the glass.

suggested_variations.name: Smoky Old Fashioned
changes: Use a smoky bourbon or add a small amount of smoked bitters
suggested_variations.description: Adds a rich smoky depth to the classic Old Fashioned.

suggested_variations.name: Maple Old Fashioned
changes: Replace sugar cube with maple syrup
suggested_variations.description: Adds a smooth maple sweetness for a seasonal twist.

skill_level_recommendation: Suitable for beginner to intermediate bartenders.
